intro: Tithymalus pseudosororius, commonly known as the lesser tithymale, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which help it conserve water in arid environments. Tithymalus pseudosororius is often found in regions of southern Europe and parts of western Asia.
